alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Johnston; Love; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 7:57PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Johnston, western Bryan, eastern Love and Marshall Counties through 830 PM CST... At 757 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Lebanon to near Thackerville to near Muenster. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madill, Tishomingo, Marietta, Kingston, Mannsville, Ravia, Thackerville, Milburn, Woodville, Fillmore, Lebanon, Russett, Willis, Little City, northern Lake Texoma, Oakland and Mcbride. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
